commentBody:
Sure, while Trump is threatening them with more tariffs?
At least, someone is speaking out. Give it to the French, they called us on the invasion of Irak as well. Remember french fries and all, the stupidity from here.  Well, redux here.

“’Would you like some nice ISIS fighters?’ Mr. Trump said, claiming that ‘many’ fighters had come from France. ‘I can give them to you.’”

Trump’s faux pas and ghastly comments are de rigueur. These horrible comments are to be expected from a déclassé world leader like him.
"Brain dead" is NATO's synonym for Trump! Actually, this depiction reflects the global view of American democracy, too!

" ... [Trump] doesn’t like confrontation in person and doesn’t quite know how to react to being on the receiving end ... "  Indeed.  Thus his preference for one way Twitter attacks and shouted comments to the press while walking to the helicopter.  No rebuttal allowed, no real press conferences.  Like all bullies, he turns coward when someone stands up to him.  Unfortunately, no Republicans have the character to do that.
Trump’s body language, including the grimace on his face, is just beautiful. He isn’t steepling with his hands. His hands are showing a bit of being cowed by their confrontation. Nice work Macron.
It's embarrassing that Macron speaks English considerably better than Trump does.
Hilarious. Blimp eliminated taxes for giant corporations and now is sad the Europeans are going to make them pay their fair share.
Trump on a public stage like this with capable, intelligent, well-  informed world leaders is an embarassment !!  He definitely, once again, showed his utter ignorance!!

Not very tense. Tense would be more forthright commentary from some of these people Trump is supposed to be "working" with (Has he ever actually worked? Really?), as in, "This fiasco must now cease. If the Americans can't contribute a leader worth talking to instead of a dubiously elected, trust-funded, draft-dodging, real estate swindling reality show host - and we're being generous, here - there's no point in talking at all."

"Trump quickly clarified his position with a Tweet saying that the “United States of America supports the brave people of Iran.”

Both statements were made at the same place and probably just a few hours apart, if even that long.

Ask any one, including his "base" supporters, who in the world will take the words of such a person seriously?

Trump is an embarrassment wherever he goes. He's always spoken of NATO negatively. Now he shows up and want so be the "leader." Instead her remains the bully or better said, a bull in a China shop. Trump possesses no "diplomatic" skills.

As Macron responded: "let's be serious," he was letting Trump know that He (Macron) was not going to let Trump talk trash or spin the conversation against Macron. So, how are Americans supposed to feel about that? Someone foreign put Trump in his place? Some one made Trump feel uncomfortable? Trump doesn't care about the average American and knows nothing that he can contribute to discussion that will assist NATO. Trump just wants to disrupt and command the media attention. In the role of representing the interest of America and the America people-- he is truly embarrassing and appears uncouth.

Boris Johnson is likely not the only person trying to maintain some distance from Trump. But, Macron was not backing down!
Trump got served.
Fraudulent Trump doesn’t know which side is up; it’s all about himself and his corrupt family.

How dare Trump suggest that the European NATO countries should pay what they pledged. 

Americans need to provide for countries that are unable or unwilling to pay, just as we need to provide for people that are unable or unwilling to work.

commentBody: Wouldn't it be great if one or two of our Republican leaders would stand up and call out Mr. Trump as well? Macron is fine. He is still the leader of France. His world has not collapsed for accurately criticizing Trump. I wish some of our Republicans legislators would grow a spine and work for us for a change.
Is it time for the USA to assert their dominance over the French again by renaming the chips sold in the Congressional Cafeteria?

commentBody:
Macron, whatever we may think of him, may have a vision for France, NATO, and the world/

Trump has NO "vision" or "strategy" for anything whatsoever, and the impact of his erratic, seat-of-the-pants style of making statements and destabilizing NATO and US relations with our allies is what's "dangerous" to all concerned.  

Only the likes of Putin gains by Trump's obscene pantomime as "president" and his ongoing destabilization of our alliances, relations with friends, and traditional allies in the face of naked aggression.

Why does the media keep using words like "vision" and "strategy" to dignify Trump's erratic words and deeds?
It’s fascinating to see an incredibly intelligent president with a vision for his country and Europe next to a babbling president slowly but surely descending into dementia and irrelevance.

"The president doesn't like confrontation in person and doesn't quite know how to react to being on the receiving end."

Like all bullies - he can dish it out but he can't take it.

Kudos Mr. Macron!!!! Trump's Achilles Heel on full display with this exchange!
Trump can dish out lies, slurs and ridiculous nonsense because the republicans have told him he is the almighty not to be challenged.
Macron a much younger man - no bankruptcies, lawsuits trailing behind him for ripping off a charity or students who had believed his college was authentic, doesn't have the same baggage.
Macron also actually understands the role NATO plays and why it is so important.
Trump's lack of anything cohesive in dialogue on full display - same day his impeachment issue comes to the front in the news globally AND in front of all those world leaders attending the NATO meetings!
Couldn't happen to a nicer guy.
“Let’s be serious” This should be said every day in response to the trump shenanigans. It should be the impeachment thesis statement and the slogan for 2020 campaigns. Thanks to Macron
Think Boris and The Donald, both New York guys, use the same colorist?

Of course NATO can't depend on America under Trump! Even America can't depend on America under Trump! America, the once Shining City on a Hill, is being systematically reduced to a laughing stock. Trump the Chump in nothing but a lying charlatan in a badly fitting suit. End this!

Bravo Macron. Hope we are seeing the end of the  child bully pathological liar’s regime. The most corrupt leader i. The world had destroyed our basic foundation and if he gets reelected, we will become a banana republic where jungle law will be the rule. He has placed 200 plus most incompetent partisan federal judges to destroy everything we have to protect us. Unfortunately, some people are mesmerized by his propaganda machine and the same happened during Nazi regime. Hope people will wake up and defeat him by a landslide. Macron is a great statesman and he is taking stand against the man who is sold to Russia. It is a travesty!
What a pleasure to see this angry feeble-minded dolt schooled by an intellectual.   I’m drinking a nice Louis Jadot Nuits Saint Georges as I read this.

Seventy years of NATO is really a big deal and under normal circumstances maybe the milestone could be more of a much needed global unifying moment rather than being overshadowed by a flawed American president on the cusp of impeachment.
Its important to Trump for other NATO members to pay more, but when it comes to him paying his fair share of American taxes, its smart not to. I miss Mr. Obama.

Trump is easily exhausted and hence duped when someone is speaking French in one ear and translating in the other. Squirming and uncomfortable he was on the defensive.  Well played Macron.  Trump is no match for anyone with an education except Trump U grads that is. He believes you just have to show up. Like this meeting, winging it from the hip putting himself in a weak position.

Europe, including especially France, has been subsidized by the US since the end of WWII.  European military protection has primarily been provided by American soldiers and American money since the end of WWII.  Even the European government medical systems, much vaunted by the American left, is subsidized from the wallets of sick Americans (American drug research is paid for by American sick people who must pay 10 times the price as is charged Europeans by the same American drug companies for the same drugs).

Now, Macron tries to shame Americans into continuing the American largess.   And many of the readers' comments here are by partisans who hate Trump so much that all they can write is to condemn Trump and praise the ungrateful and selfish Macron.

A broken clock displays the accurate time twice a day.  So, too, even Trump can be correct occasionally, even if only by mistake.
replies:
[{'commentID': 103955765, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103955765, 'userID': 27056886, 'userDisplayName': 'Mark W', 'userLocation': 'New York', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': 'NATO is a strategic alliance whose purpose is to prevent a scenario that could very easily have happened during WW II, ie , the US does not enter the war until it’s too late, leaving us isolated and possibly losing the war. 

Trump, as he does so frequently, has misunderstood NATO’s purpose and somehow thinks that we can “win” NATO by getting other members to pay more of the bill.  While nice , it is just not that important when compared to its mission.   At the same time he has left the alliance in disarray.  

And, while getting NATO members to pay more, he has charged the American taxpayer 200 million dollars for ... golf outings.', 'createDate': '1575422808', 'updateDate': '1575517917', 'approveDate': '1575424080', 'recommendations': 20, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103954818, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Errol', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103955765', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103957202, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103957202, 'userID': 20871142, 'userDisplayName': 'Errol', 'userLocation': 'Medford OR', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/pimage.timespeople.nytimes.com/avatars/cropped-743f7ede19aaf858a5b82b1d45d4f48d9a2343b2678e2682bc43fc4c4206736c.jpg', 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "@Mark W 

Your reference to Trump's golf outings is irrelevant to this discussion.

Trump's golf outing costs are an outrage.  Every president similarly outrages with their spending (remember the Grand World Tour by Obama and his legion of pals and their spouses?).  Every president should be restrained from such excess.  OK lets start with Trump.  But I would bet dollars to doughnuts that you intense partisans won't similarly go after the next president from your party any more than you have ever called to task a past president of your party.", 'createDate': '1575430092', 'updateDate': '1575430206', 'approveDate': '1575430206', 'recommendations': 0, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103955765, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Errol', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103957202', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103957736, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103957736, 'userID': 69630370, 'userDisplayName': 'Jmart', 'userLocation': 'DC', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': "The US has proven to be an unreliable ally under this administration. That's because Trump has dismantled multilateral agreements, pulled out of an ongoing conflict without any warning, support or strategy for our allies, constantly questioned the purpose of NATO, given praise to authoritarian leaders, and provided no clear foreign affairs strategy. He seems to be just making it up as he goes, which is kind of helpful in the China negotiations, because I don't think China knows how to respond half the time, but it's not the way to go in other aspects of foreign policy. It didn't seem like he even understood his administration's stance on Iran. Anyway, your partisanship will not allow you to see that Trump has not been a reliable or strategic world leader. Critiquing him is not partisan vitriol: it's basic observation from people who study these subjects. And honestly, his supporters liked the fact that he was controversial, rude, and arrogant during the campaign. You can't all the sudden be surprised that others have not warmed up to his off-putting personality or that his personality has not changed while in office. I can't think of anyone who would advise that the best way to lead and inspire loyalty is to insult people, bully people on Twitter, constantly ignore experts, lie about things that don't even matter, micromanage and undermine the naval disciplinary procedure, and destroy the morale of your administrators who are responsible for implementing your policies.", 'createDate': '1575433296', 'updateDate': '1575520395', 'approveDate': '1575434601', 'recommendations': 5, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103955765, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Errol', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103957736', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
Macron is just saying what all US allies already know.

I think it was right for Macron to be forthright about the problem and express it with Trump in the room.

It’s not news that the United States cannot be completely trusted for protecting Europe and France from Russian aggression... that’s the primary reason why Charles de Gaulle pushed for France to develop its own independent 
nuclear arsenal!

The President of the United States has very selective hearing.  He hears what he wants to hear and is deaf to anything else.  This selective hearing allows him to think he is beyond compare and to turn off any criticism.  Like the emperor's new clothes he will be found to be naked but he still has to be voted out in November and we can't guarantee that.
Macron just gave Trump the middle-finger on international television, and I couldn't agree more. But, I think Robert De Niro summed up my feelings towards Trump better than anyone.

Putin must be watching the NATO gathering of heads of state and may be quite pleased with Trump’s performce. 
His stooge has managed to pit France and other members of the Alliance against Turkey, while demonstrating his solidarity with Erdogan, who had bought Russian S-400 air defence system, enabling Russian military intelligence to learn more about the Alliance’s military hardware, including the F-35 fighter jets etc.
Macron did the right thing to stand up to Trump, who is old enough to be the father of his French counterpart. Yet it is the younger Macron who taught an older Trump to stop behaving like a  troublesome schoolboy. 
Apparently Macron's original condemnation of NATO’s “brain death” stemmed from his anger at the lack of any Turkish coordination with the rest of the Alliance over its invasion in northeastern Syria. 
Only Trump was consulted, and he gave Erdogan the green light to crack down on the Syrian Kurds, leading to widespread condemnation for betraying a staunch ally in the region. Some 11.000 Kurds lost their lives in  aiding the US to fight ISIS.

@Sketco 

“Insulting, disrespectful and dangerous is the way Mr. Trump has continuously and consistently characterized the truth.”

Don't forget how Trump characterized Macron's comments as "very nasty" (as though some things are only plain nasty).  

I thank Macron for confronting Trump face-to-face.  Trump needs to be on the receiving end more often.
We really need someone who can read a book for our next president. Even if it’s Artie The Smartie, it would be a spectacular achievement over the past two Republican administrations.

commentBody:
If you were writing a fictional movie script and you inserted all of this drama about NATO and Macron vs. Trump and then ALSO had the congressional impeachment report be released on the same day the studio would reject your script as being too far-fetched.

Except this is reality, this did happen! And someday this MAY be made into a movie. I suppose Alec Baldwin can play Trump, but we'll need someone really good to play Macron. Adam Driver?

France, if you're listening, continue to push back against this 
capricious demagogue.

What a miserable, defensive and posturing person, Trump is. He obviously doesn’t listen, waits only to hear himself speak. His body language is off putting. He can’t handle direct confrontation? What a baby. His backhanded ‘confidence’ hides behind Twitter thumbs and 6 year old degradation by way of name calling. Imagine the shame he must feel on the daily.
I feel really conflicted at being happy when a French President gives our POTUS a rhetorical black eye in public.  I truly wish this wasn’t the case now or ever.

Trump spits on all of our true allies and kisses up to Putin. What more does one need to know about Trump's continuous pursuit of self-interest over national interest?  He is the face of the Republican Party that does exactly the same.
Merci beaucoup Mr. Macron for being the adult in the room to the toddler from the US.

How LAUGHABLE to call the Europeans US allies. They are DEPENDENTS.  For over a cenury it has been a one way flow of lives and money from the US to Euorpe. Long past time for the Europeans to start pulling their own weight and start  paying for their own defense.
replies: [{'commentID': 103957851, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103957851, 'userID': 69630370, 'userDisplayName': 'Jmart', 'userLocation': 'DC', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\\//>', 'commentBody': 'The reason we started defending Europe is because they are major trading partners: they have a lot invested here, and we have invested a lot over there. If one of them or a few of them gets attacked or destabilizes somehow, that negatively affects us. This is also the real reason we entered WW2 in the first place. Not to mention, it would be a strategic loss if Europe fell prey to a hostile power. Could Europe be a little more grateful? Yes. Is it worth risking destabilization in the region? No.', 'createDate': '1575434099', 'updateDate': '1575449573', 'approveDate': '1575434598', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103954541, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Reader In Wash, DC', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103957851', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody: i can't wait until Trump is all alone and responds via a rude tweet about Macron

Macron is professional, well versed in policy and well briefed by his team.

The American president is not even worth discussing, to call him a lightweight would be complimentary.

What I liked about this exchange was the stark contrast between Pro and Fool.

One final note,NATO members are fighting in I think about 5 actions right now?  I could be wrong, but a busy organization none the less, if you don't like NATO, I get it, you have some points.   However if  you ever need NATO?  Don't break it because you will never be able to put back together  - however, America is at the mercy of an idiot - with a solid and loyal worship by thousands and enabled by the most historically craven cabal of Republicans to ever be elected.

United States of Lies and Falsehoods.

Macron can smell a patsy a mile away, like Trump.
While Macron has a glass of water, Trump has a glass of Coke.

Wait a minute
We, us taxpayers, sent this guy to a NATO conference and he spends two hours gabbing with reporters and then a three million dollar fundraiser for his re-elections campaign. On our dime????
This is insane. Get this guy out of office now!
Well Mr. Trump the truth hurts doesn't it.
What a picture.  Trump looks as though he has just been sent to time out.

What really irks the Donald is how quickly the stage can be reset and the hook from the sidelines is pulling him off of it. He feels it... Macron is making him KNOW IT!  What idiot sits around and waits for the downfall?

Macron is saying in so many words.. we are moving ahead.  Now it’s going to cost YOU!
We HAD a good deal, both sides.  Trump blew it. 

Do we all get bailed out like the farmers?? WITH OUR OWN TAX DOLLARS? No !! Only the people in the states that elected him are getting that money.  We will have no jobs with no one to sell to except ourselves. 

When they DONT need us, China, Europe, etc all... what will Trump have accomplished?  BTW ...  tax money to farmers IS socialism.

Macron gambled and lost 18 mos ago with his military parade and state dinner for visiting Trump. He now realizes his error. 

If Macron lived in NYC -- or had some decent advisors -- he woulda known that this was a straight-up stupid gamble. An idiotic strategy to "win over" the degenerate Trump.

Now Macron is acting the "righteous statesman". Great. We're rooting for ya, dude. 

Trump is a capital-M Monster. Who must be destroyed. Macron, alas, is a business-world trained buffoon.

By validating Turkey's grab for Others space Russian, Chinese actions are validated utilising the same reasoning - 'Let us not worry about who owns what.' - Exactly the response to Hitlers take over of Others space - so what happens. It never stops until... you are lucky to survive the inevitable first strike.
Trump’s face reveals the fact that his brain is only processing one word every five seconds. Macron’s english runs circles around our illiterate president.

When you elect an idiot like Donald Trump of course we can no longer trust the US.

Time for a European defence force and the removal of US bases across Europe.
And still the NY Times doesn't call for Trump's impeachment and removal from office.

Brilliant strategy by Macron!  We cannot trust the United States.  Let NATO be more European dependent and the interests of NATO more European centric!  Just the outcome Putin wanted (not!) ... hahaha.  A strong allied Europe, able to protect Eastern Europe, Baltic states and Greece; punish Turkey and force it into alignment on Syria, ISIS, and whatever other Middle Eastern hazard arises, a strong counterweight against Russia.  Bravo Macron!  Love seeing our idiot president flummoxed, his mouth SHUT for a change !
You don't impeach presidents who are innocent. Well, duh.

Vive la France!  Thank you President  Macron for saying what needed to be said. And when Trump questioned the value of NATO, suggesting that it may be obsolete, I believe he was quietly alluding to his real agenda,  which  goes back before his election: To form some kind of  pact with Russia and  forcing Europe to fall in line.

I believe that the relationship between Europe and the US will not recover. Ever.  The belief that there were shared values and democratic ideals, common goals and benefits between Europe and the US has been shattered. No matter who is in the WH Europeans now know, and have since 2016, that the US cannot be trusted anymore. 

The relationship will not dissolve immediately, it will take time to unravel entirely as to become meaningless. 
 
People don't look up to the US because of its wealth, there are countries far wealthier, it's not because of its history of genocide against Native Americans, of slavery, of segregation, of gun violence or of inequalities and greed.
Its because in spite of all these there was the belief that the dream black Americans fought so hard for, a dream of freedom and of dignity and respect, of human rights for all meant something and that most American did believe that, 

Down the long lane of history yet to be written America knows that this world of ours, ever growing smaller, must avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate, and be instead, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect. Such a confederation must be one of equals.
Dwight Eisenhower.

commentBody: Lets get out of Europe all together. What are US troops doing there in a first place? Europe buys Russian oil and gas and then pretends that it fears Russia. If you fear Russia then stop buying their energy and other products.

commentBody: The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics fell apart after its military humiliation in Afghanistan. The Baltic States, Belarus, Ukraine, and the 'Stans are all renegade secessionist Socialist Republics to the remaining Muscovy core.

From the elevation of Trump by the Electoral College, the lesson has been underscored time and again: Leadership and authority are two very different things.

The horrible flaw of the Electoral College is that it artificially puts people in the ultimate position of American leadership without the absolutely necessary support of the followers. Thus Trump is the boss, but was never the leader of the United States.

Trump has wildly abused his presidential authority, including his attempt to subvert the collective authority of the NATO allies. Alienation has resulted, and now he finds out that his artificially created leadership doesn't mean very much.

When people must submit to authority that they do not respect as leaders, resentment grows. It can become animosity. Then violent hostility.

This is how revolutions are born. The revolt of NATO has begun. One wonders when, and how, Americans will revolt against Trump.

commentBody: NATO allies essentially despise and distrust Trump as much as as slim majority of Americans.  Selling one's soul to Trump never ends well for the seller in the long run

Trump cannot be serious because he is not a serious person. He is an infant that inherited great wealth and power from his daddy, and never had to do a lick of work in his life.

He was elected not for any policy reason but to flip the board and destroy society as it exists today. His voters are people that hate you and want to hurt you. They hate you so much they would hurt themselves to hurt you. So much that they would hurt their own children to hurt you.

As Adam Serwer from the Atlantic said: the cruelty is the point.

Strikes me that Macron is calling Trump's bluff and bluster.

Trump consistently demonstrates that no one or no entity can count on his word from hour to hour.

Furthermore, there is more than a bit of evidence that Trump is Putin's lapdog and NATO has always been a line of defense against the ambitions of the Russians.

Macron and the rest of Europe have good reason to think Trump would sell them for a few kopeks.

This is the same president who stood on a campaign stage a few weeks ago and mimicked the sound of a sexual act, to the claps and cheers of his supporters. I was appalled. It was disgusting and gross, and extremely embarrassing to the American people. 

And this is the same president who expects our allies to respect him and take him seriously? No way. They had him figured out years ago.
this is more of a loss cause now Trump got another chance of winning if he does not get impeached

Trump did just fine. He has Macron out of his comfort zone and knows it. Trump takes criticism 24/7 365, it’s the left who can’t stand to be criticized. Just observe the circus impeachment. Trump is trying to get NATO to actually do their job which is a good thing. Had Trump not been elected it would have been business as usual, so Trump actually brought things to light that need a healthy debate. You should thank him.

commentBody: This was the "Love Actually" moment that I've been waiting for...finally, someone really pushing back at our bloviating bully of a president.

“The dramatic moment, which came as both leaders were in London to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the NATO alliance, underscored how a relationship formerly known for  lingering hugs, lint-brushing and white-knuckle handshakes has devolved over divisions on matters ranging from terrorism to trade policy.”
————————————-

“Devolved”? The “lint-brushing and white-knuckle handshakes” were acts of pure passive-aggression on Trump’s part, and like everything else he does, far. far beneath the dignity of the office he stole.

I’d say Macron’s recent performance represents an evolution rather than a devolution; Macron is learning to beat Trump at his own game.
Macron exposed Trump for the simpleton bully he is. Touché!

Macron may not be my favorite French leader, and has made missteps, but like Merkel, he is intellectually far above Trump, and commands English, not his native tongue, far better than Trump who was born in NY.
Most of all, he is an adult and a leader - Trump a child demagogue.

Macron, take back the ISIS fighters that came from France, it is the right thing to do. Not some, but all. Why do you expect the US to take care of your problems. And, then pay your fair share of NATO costs, address the immigration concerns and issues in your country, and work towards addressing problems related to terrorism world wide.

“Let’s be serious” sums it all — thank you Mr Macron for not sitting pretty and keeping a frozen smile on while being pranked by the big bully. Governing is not a joke or entertainment to rack up poll numbers. Lives are affected by every move a high political figure makes.

Leaders convene; whatever their ideologies and behaviors.
According to protocols... Someone’s...
Hands shaken; heads in various directions.    For some; not at all.
Words, written and voiced,are created by...and transmitted.    
Received.  Understood?
Discussed.    Compromised.
And all the while, wherever, human rights are abrogated.
Menschlichkeit is ravished.
Complacency and complicity partner with WILLFUL 
blindness.
deafness.
indifference, and 
SILENCE as
NATO’s letters remain;
its mandate watered down.          Daily.
Hail the Trumps and Erdogans.     Their words and ways.
Their lies and libels.

President Trump is discovering that he can’t joke and bluster his way through the issues when he’s not surrounded by his imperial court. And his lack of historical knowledge and preparation becomes painfully obvious when he tries to engage. He’s a “world leader” who is constantly having his lunch money stolen by others.

Bravo Mr Marcon.  Like any other bully, Donald Trump has no idea what to do with someone who stands up straight and tall and gives it right back to him.  Just like a toddler, you need to survive their first bullet because they have nothing after.  Trump laid this bed.  This treatment is long overdue.  They aren't afraid of you Mr Trump and they see you for what you really are.

Macron is right.  The rest of NATO cannot count on the US because the POTUS is a flake; making decisions with out any background consideration, or effect on other members.  It's as if the US has an 11-yr old in charge.  Trump is the anthesis of a well though out strategy and decision-making.  Thus, our allies cannot count on his word.  It'll change by the next day.  
  Every conversation Trump has with any leader must be monitored for consistency with decades of US policy.  He has virtually ended any hope of a Palestinian homeland, ruined our relationship with the Kurds, has backed down to Turkey, and is a puppet of Putin.  Kim Jong Un played Trump for a sucker.  Why would any western country place any credence in anything Trump 
says or promises?  No reason.  He's not a bully, rather, a coward.

It is clear to the world that Trump is incompetent. Some countries are stroking his ego to get what they want from the United States. Macron decided to strip the king Trump by being blunt and expose him of what he is. It is working at no one’s surprise. A lesson for Democrats to call him who he is with very blunt language and stand by it.
I hope Donald turns over NATO to Europe, where it belongs, before he leaves.  It would be a shame to have an irrational president for nothing.

So let me see...

Trump considers himself the leader of the free world, and by proxy, the leader of NATO.

Macron sees NATO as brain dead.


I see the connection here.  Macron gets my vote.
Does Trump even know what NATO stands for?

I often do not support Trump's actions relative to Europe.

However, I think Macron's statement is a cynical effort to embarrass the US into continuing the role we and Europe have played for the past nearly 75 years.  Since the end of WWII, the US has subsidized Europe generally and taken on nearly all of the burden of military defense of European nations.  Now this pipsqueak Frenchie, Macron, essentially demands that the US continue its largess so that Europe can continue prospering at US expense.

Macron would be a nothing, under a fascist thumb, if his grandparents' France was not rescued by the gift American soldiers, the gift of American lives, and the gift of American industrial might and a lot of American labor.  And for then 35 years after the US saved them from their fascist fate, they were subsidized by the US while US military protected them from communist domination. 

Macron should go home and commiserate with his ungrateful, selfish European brethren.

commentBody:
Hey France. 
Without us you’d all be speaking German. Because you begged us to save you (twice, I may add) you may as well thank us by letting America (cue bald eagle & a winking Uncle Sam) have your wine for free & give every fat rich yankee tourist a personal discount to the Eiffel & Louvre. 
France, 
USA Saved Since 1944.

commentBody: Trump can't even spell "NATO."  Sad.

Why do so many NATO leaders criticize M. Macron for calling out Mr Trump for his very, very bad behavior toward NATO allies? Trump is a callous bully who deserves much more than Macron gave him. I wish we had a few more like President Macron in our own government. When will the world stop kowtowing to Trump despite the fact that they all know that he is an ignorant self-absorbed circus clown with little understanding of how the world really works?
NATO, the World, please hang in there until 2020. We sane Americans are doing our best to rid ourselves, and you, of this nightmare of buffoonery and incompetence.

NATO should rescind Trump's invitation and tell him to go pound sand.
The only place Trump is welcome is Israel.

327 million people in this country and the best person we could find to run it is an insufferable country club bore? A racist, draft-dodging, loud-mouthed, pathologically lying know-nothing-know-it-all? A man who, for much of an entire decade, was the single biggest financial loser in the entire country? A man who, aside from the brain-dead losers that worship him, no one can stand to be around? A man who represents every single detestable human trait all rolled into one? That guy? That's the best we can do? Every time he opens his stupid mouth I feel like I'm going to be sick.

Who knew this country could produce such an incredible loser - let alone elect him to run things?
Sending Trump overseas feels the same to me as walking into church naked.

What a buffoon this Trump is. Attack your oldest ally, attack the one who is the most engaged in the fight with you. Threaten them with tariffs.  What is his major disfunction? There are only two explanations: 
One he is the Russian Manchurian candidate. Doing Moscow bidding by setting on fire the alliances that have permitted America to lead.
Two he wants to set the world on fire before he goes down in flames.
The consequences will be drastic. The U.S. will head to at the very minimum an economic conflict with the E.U.,  because unlike alliances with America the E.U. will stick together. At worst America will have lost Europe and will be left standing alone.
It is already clear that America can not be counted on, just ask the Kurds. And it's not an election that will change that.
The chosen one right? Yes absolutely chosen by Putin.  Republicans do your job and impeach this imposter!!!

Because Trump is an imbecile who has no concept of what NATO even is, why it was created or what purpose it continues to serve, he’s also the perfect Russian Useful Idiot. Macron was standing up for NATO by condemning the current lunacy, so Mr. Nasty played his assigned saboteur role by projecting his own infantile nastiness onto Macron.

No doubt, whatever they may say openly, our European allies are quietly and fervently praying to Adam Schiff, asking a la Henry II, ‘will no one rid us of this tiresome President?’

Marcron and the entire French psyche have never been able to accept the fact that De Gaulle rode back into Paris on a United States Sherman tank.
"Paris! Paris outraged! Paris broken! Paris martyred! But Paris liberated! Liberated by itself, liberated by its people with the help of the French armies, with the support and the help of all France, of the France that fights, of the only France, of the real France, of the eternal France!”
Uh, did De Gaulle reference the U.S. and the Allies here?  Nah......  Typical.

Of course, President Macron is right.  As long as Trump and his band of thieves corrupt our White House, the United States' word is suspect.  Just as what's happened here in the White House, parts of the Judiciary, one half of the Congress, the whole Republican Party, large swaths of the mediashere, and, most devastatingly,around 40% of the  American public, NATO and the G7 are being infected by Trump's corrosive mix of self-serving lies, ignorance, immorality, and just plain boorishness.  The task for the world is to resist being sucked into Trump's vortex of chaos until we lawfully rid ourselves of this menace, his copycats, and his enablers.

I find myself supporting anyone or anything that DJT shows disdain for and Macron can be added to that list.


It also includes:

Our NATO allies 
The entire US intelligence community 
ABC
NBC
CBS
CNN
All democrats 
Goldstar families 
All scientists 
Our military 
Farmers
John McCain
Facts 
The New York Times 
The Constitution

Macron spoke words of truth. Trump attempts, as all pathological narcissists do, to manipulate everyone around him.
H e is close to being impeached  for just that: trying to manipulate the Ukranian president to get dirt on the Bidens. 
Why would Macron trust our country anymore?

Europe could no longer assume American support was “a very dangerous statement.”    Uhhh, yeah; we have to assume at this point that this the sort of thing that gets you up in the morning, Donald (nice thumb, by the way).  Otherwise, "Booorrr-ing!", right?
Most of the middle age and youth in Europe do not know the WWI and WWII and which country stepped in to free them from Nazi and USSR

Maybe some of you smart peeps can help this UT hick understand something.

Russia's military budget is $61B (down 23% from '16 due to their rotten economy). They spend only 7% as much on War as all NATO countries combined, less than 10% of the US alone. 

Their GDP is 14th globally, less than Brazil, Italy, New York state and Texas. They're half the size of California and less than 8% of the US. By all accounts, their economy is in the toilet. 

How is Russia such a supposed global boogeyman? If they're actually good enuf' to cause all the disruption assigned to them, doncha' think they'd be able to make their country function better? 

Are they that much more capable than we are that they're able to be a "global threat" while spending dimes vs dollars? Or (pause to don tin-foil hat) are they really a Paper Bear? A monster-under-the-bed that's not really there when you look, a Be-Afraid-Be-Very-Afraid illusion that the MIC and the War Profiteers rattle in the dark to keep us malleable and afraid? Is Russia the convenient enemy-du-jour that justifies spending gobs of our tax dollars on profitable, perpetual war, with all of it's money-making, hidden corruption? 

Why doesn't NATO, with all it's power, squash 'em like a grape (metaphorically, of course - w/ sanctions, internal disruptions, shunning…)?

Maybe some of you smart folks know the answer?
